meanings.definition: A feeling of listlessness and dissatisfaction arising from a lack of occupation or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The ennui he felt during the long, boring lecture was palpable.
meanings.sent2: She tried to alleviate her ennui by taking up a new hobby.
meanings.sent3: The ennui of waiting in line at the DMV was almost unbearable.
meanings.sent4: His ennui was like a heavy fog that clouded his mind.
meanings.sent5: The ennui of the rainy day seemed to seep into her bones.
